titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَ هُوَ مُتَلَثِّمٌ أَوْ مُخْتَضِبٌ أَوْ لَا يُخْرِجُ يَدَيْهِ مِنْ تَحْتِ الثَّوْبِ فِي صَلَاتِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 62 – The man prays Salāt and he is veiled, or dyed, or he does not take out his hand from beneath the clothes in his Salāt

titles.ar: باب صَلَاةِ الصِّبْيَانِ وَ مَتَى يُؤْخَذُونَ بِهَا
titles.en: Chapter 63 – The Salāt of the children, and when they should begin Salāt

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي فِي الثَّوْبِ وَ هُوَ غَيْرُ طَاهِرٍ عَالِماً أَوْ جَاهِلًا
titles.en: Chapter 61 – The man prays Salāt in the clothes and they are without cleanliness, knowingly or unknowingly

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَ هُوَ مُتَلَثِّمٌ أَوْ مُخْتَضِبٌ أَوْ لَا يُخْرِجُ يَدَيْهِ مِنْ تَحْتِ الثَّوْبِ فِي صَلَاتِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 62 – The man prays Salāt and he is veiled, or dyed, or he does not take out his hand from beneath the clothes in his Salāt

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/329)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ رِبْعِيٍّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لَهُ أَ يُصَلِّي الرَّجُلُ وَ هُوَ مُتَلَثِّمٌ فَقَالَ أَمَّا عَلَى الْأَرْضِ فَلَا وَ أَمَّا عَلَى الدَّابَّةِ فَلَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin ShAzaan, from Hammad Bin Isa from Rabie, from Muhammad Bin Muslim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws, said, ‘I said to himasws, ‘Can the man pray Salāt while he is veiled?’ So heasws said: ‘As for upon the ground, so no, and as for upon the animal, so there is no problem’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan, from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Rib‘i, from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man’s performing Salah (prayer) with his face veiled. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not permissible while on the ground; however, while riding on a stumper is not an offense.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/330)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ الْحَضْرَمِيِّ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَ عَلَيْهِ خِضَابُهُ قَالَ لَا يُصَلِّي وَ هُوَ عَلَيْهِ وَ لَكِنْ يَنْزِعُهُ إِذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يُصَلِّيَ قُلْتُ إِنَّ حِنَّاهُ وَ خِرْقَتَهُ نَظِيفَةٌ فَقَالَ لَا يُصَلِّي وَ هُوَ عَلَيْهِ وَ الْمَرْأَةُ أَيْضاً لَا تُصَلِّي وَ عَلَيْهَا خِضَابُهَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Al Husayn Bin Usman, from Ibn Muskan, from Abu Bakr Al Hazramy who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullahasws about the man who prays Salāt and upon him is his dye’. Heasws said: ‘He should not pray Salāt while it is upon him, but he should remove it when he intends to pray Salāt’. I said, ‘If his henna and his cloth is clean?’ So heasws said: ‘He cannot pray Salāt while it is upon him; and the woman as well, she cannot pray Salāt and upon her is her dye’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Fadalah ibn Ayyub from al-Husayn ibn ‘Uthman from ibn Muskan from abu Bakr al-Hadramiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs Salah (prayer) with dyes (paint) on him. He (the Imam) said, ‘He must not perform Salah (prayer) while it is on him. He must remove it when he wants to perform Salah (prayer).’ I (the narrator) then asked, ‘Is it acceptable if it is inside a piece of fabric which is clean?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘He must not perform Salah (prayer) while it is on him and a woman also must not perform Salah (prayer) while it is on her.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/330)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ

text: كُنْتُ عِنْدَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَدَخَلَ عَلَيْهِ عَبْدُ الْمَلِكِ الْقُمِّيُّ فَقَالَ أَصْلَحَكَ اللَّهُ أَسْجُدُ وَ يَدِي فِي ثَوْبِي فَقَالَ إِنْ شِئْتَ قَالَ ثُمَّ قَالَ إِنِّي وَ اللَّهِ مَا مِنْ هَذَا وَ شِبْهِهِ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abdul Rahman Bin Al Hajjaj who said,

‘I was in the presence of Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, and Abdul Malik Al-Qummy came over to him<sup>asws</sup> and he said, ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Keep you<sup>asws</sup> well! Can I prostrate while my hand is inside my clothes?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If you so desire to’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: I, ‘By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>!; am not afraid for you because of this and things similar to it’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj who has said the following: “I once was with abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, when ‘Abd al-Malik al-Qummiy came and asked saying, ‘I pray to Allah to keep you well, I perform Sajdah (prostration) and my hands are inside my clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘If you want, you can do so.’ He (the narrator) has said that he (the Imam) then said, ‘I, by Allah, am not afraid for you because of this and things similar to it.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/330)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ عَمَّنْ رَوَاهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصَلِّي وَ هُوَ يُومِئُ عَلَى دَابَّتِهِ قَالَ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Numan, from the one who reported it,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws regarding the man who prays Salāt upon his animal and he is gesturing (while praying). Heasws said: ‘He should uncover the place of the prostration (e.g. on the saddle)’.
en.sarwar: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Nu‘man from those who he has mentioned who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who performs Sajdah (prostration) on the saddle while on horseback, has said, ‘He must clear the place for his Sajdah (prostration).”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/331)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ صَلَّى فَرِيضَةً

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ مُصَادِفٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي رَجُلٍ صَلَّى فَرِيضَةً وَ هُوَ مُعَقَّصُ الشَّعْرِ قَالَ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Musadif,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws regarding a man who prays an Obligatory Salāt and he has curled up the hair. Heasws said: ‘He should repeat his Salāt’.
en.sarwar: 5. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from Musadif who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who bundles up his hairs on the top of his head, has said, ‘He is required to perform his Salah (prayer) again.’” (Fatwa best explains this Hadith.)
